meanings.definition: A matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome.
meanings.sent1: The math problem was challenging, but I solved it with help.
meanings.sent2: She faced a big problem when her car broke down on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The problem of the missing sock turned out to be hiding in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent4: His constant lateness was a problem that needed to be addressed.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet was a persistent problem in the old house.

meanings.definition: A question proposed for solution or discussion.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave us a tricky problem to solve in class today.
meanings.sent2: The problem of how to improve recycling rates is a hot topic.
meanings.sent3: The problem of what to have for dinner sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The problem of climate change requires urgent attention from world leaders.
meanings.sent5: The problem of finding a cure for the disease is a complex challenge.

meanings.sent1: She had a problem with her computer crashing every time she opened a certain program.
meanings.sent2: The problem of getting lost in the new city was stressful for him.
meanings.sent3: His problem with forgetting important dates led to missed appointments.
meanings.sent4: The problem of not having enough time to finish the project was frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The problem of the noisy neighbors kept him up at night.
